premise_source_doc_sentence: Philip Seymour Hoffman  (  July 23 , 1967 -- February 2 , 2014  )  was an American actor , director , and producer of film and theater .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Best known for his distinctive supporting and character roles -- typically lowlifes , bullies , and misfits -- Hoffman made many films from the early 1990s until his death at age 46 .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Drawn to theater as a teenager , Hoffman studied acting at New York University 's Tisch School of the Arts .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He began his screen career in a 1991 episode of Law & Order and started to appear in films in 1992 .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He gained recognition for his supporting work , notably in Boogie Nights  (  1997  )  , Happiness  (  1998  )  , Patch Adams  (  1998  )  , The Big Lebowski  (  1998  )  , Magnolia  (  1999  )  , The Talented Mr. Ripley  (  1999  )  , Almost Famous  (  2000  )  , Punch-Drunk Love  (  2002  )  , and Along Came Polly  (  2004  )  .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He began to occasionally play leading roles , and for his portrayal of the author Truman Capote in Capote  (  2005  )  , won multiple accolades including the Academy Award for Best Actor .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Hoffman 's profile continued to grow , and he received three more Oscar nominations for his supporting work as a brutally frank CIA officer in Charlie Wilson 's War  (  2007  )  , a priest accused of pedophilia in Doubt  (  2008  )  , and the charismatic leader of a Scientology-type movement in The Master  (  2012  )  .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: While he mainly worked in independent films , including The Savages  (  2007  )  and Synecdoche , New York  (  2008  )  , Hoffman also appeared in Hollywood blockbusters , such as Twister  (  1996  )  and Mission : Impossible III  (  2006  )  , and in one of his final roles , as Plutarch Heavensbee in the Hunger Games series  (  2013 -- 15  )  .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The feature Jack Goes Boating  (  2010  )  marked his debut as a filmmaker .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Hoffman was also an accomplished theater actor and director .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He joined the off-Broadway LAByrinth Theater Company in 1995 , where he directed , produced , and appeared in numerous stage productions .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His performances in three Broadway plays -- True West  (  2000  )  , Long Day 's Journey into Night  (  2003  )  , and Death of a Salesman  (  2012  )  -- all led to Tony Award nominations .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Hoffman struggled with drug addiction as a young adult , and relapsed in 2013 after many years of sobriety .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In February 2014 , he was found dead with a syringe of heroin still in his arm , but the official cause of death was combined drug intoxication -- an unexpected event that was widely lamented in the film and theater industries .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Remembered for his fearlessness in playing reprehensible characters , and for bringing depth and humanity to such roles , Hoffman was described in his New York Times obituary as `` perhaps the most ambitious and widely admired American actor of his generation '' .

claim: Philip Seymour Hoffman has a Golden Award.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In 2008 , Adams played a nun in the drama Doubt , opposite Philip Seymour Hoffman and Meryl Streep , for which she garnered her second Oscar nomination for Best Supporting Actress and won the Spotlight Award from the Palm Springs International Film Festival .

premise_source_doc_sentence: Tom Hanks , Julia Roberts , and Philip Seymour Hoffman starred , with Amy Adams and Ned Beatty in supporting roles .
